Question: This abruptly ended in 1693, and at the same time this person suffered a nervous breakdown.
Hints: One of this person's cases as the King's attorney was against William Chaloner.
In 1691, Duillier started to write a new version of this person's Principia, and corresponded with Leibniz.
When Robert Hooke criticised some of this person's ideas, this person was so offended that he withdrew from public debate.
